WorkItem.ClosedComment: Yes, PHPExcel tries to be clever and treat anything beginning with "=" as a formula. If you have a string that begins with "=" you explicitly need to set it as a string by using the setCellValueExplicit() method. This is documented behaviour.
WorkItem.Description:
Happy new year !

I got a fatal exception for a report, where one cell started with "= <numbers and text>". I could mitigate that, but would like to bring this to attention here.

Thank you !!

The file name "report.php" is my PHP script using the module ...

Fatal error: Uncaught exception 'Exception' with message <cell description> 
-> internal error' in PHPexcel/Classes/PHPExcel/Cell.php:288 
Stack trace: #0 PHPexcel/Classes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel5/Worksheet.php(441): PHPExcel_Cell->getCalculatedValue() 
#1 PHPexcel/Classes/PHPExcel/Writer/Excel5.php(171): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5_Worksheet->close() 
#2 report.php(144): PHPExcel_Writer_Excel5->save('/home/...') 
#3 {main} thrown in PHPexcel/Classes/PHPExcel/Cell.php on line 288
WorkItem.Summary: uncaught exception in report file when special characters occur
